result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived. Pay costs and surcharges that can not be waived or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

- AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
- Maintain absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.
- Mental health assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
- Letter of apology to Byron C. (Pick and Save).
- Seek/maintain full time employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric D Butler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eric D Butler in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Eric D Butler not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties request some additional time to conduct another pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick n Save or Byron C

Defendant Eric D Butler in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Eric D Butler in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
